title: The Missing Project
intro:
You arrive at school early on science fair day, excited to set up your volcano project in the gym. The hallways echo with your footsteps as you carry your supplies toward the gymnasium. When you push through the double doors, you notice something strange.

Your assigned table sits empty, but scattered around it are pieces of what looks like a broken model solar system. Across the gym, you see Kai frantically searching through a box of materials while Maya stands nearby, holding a crumpled piece of paper. The gym teacher, Mr. Rodriguez, is setting up chairs at the far end of the room.

checkpoints.prompt:
You set your volcano materials on your table and look more closely at the scattered pieces. Some appear to be painted planets, and there's a bent wire that might have held them in orbit. Kai looks up from his box and catches your eye, then glances toward Maya, who is now reading the crumpled paper more carefully.

The science fair doesn't start for another hour, but other students will begin arriving soon to set up their projects.

choices.text: Walk directly over to Kai and ask what happened to the solar system project
Gather the scattered planet pieces and place them on the empty table next to yours
Continue setting up your volcano while keeping an eye on Kai and Maya

checkpoints.prompt:
Maya unfolds the paper completely and you can see it's covered with drawings and measurements. She walks over to where the planet pieces are scattered and kneels down, comparing something on the paper to the broken pieces. Kai closes his box and starts walking toward the gym exit, but stops when he sees Maya examining the debris.

"I thought I put everything away safely last night," Maya says, though she's speaking quietly and you're not sure if she's talking to herself or to someone else.

choices.text: Ask Maya if she needs help fixing her project
Look around the gym for any other clues about what might have happened

checkpoints.prompt:
You notice a small trail of glitter leading from Maya's table toward the storage closet where students keep their materials overnight. The closet door is slightly ajar, and you can see boxes and project supplies stacked inside. Kai has returned and is now helping Maya sort through the broken pieces, while Mr. Rodriguez continues arranging chairs, occasionally glancing in your direction.

Other students are starting to filter into the gym with their projects, and the room is beginning to fill with the sounds of setup and conversation.

choices.text: Follow the glitter trail to the storage closet and investigate
Approach Mr. Rodriguez and mention what you observed
Focus on perfecting your own volcano setup while staying nearby

ending: The gym continues to fill with students and parents as the science fair officially begins. Maya has managed to create a new display using her detailed drawings and the salvageable planet pieces, while Kai helps her explain the solar system to visitors. Your volcano demonstration draws a small crowd, and you notice Mr. Rodriguez making notes on his clipboard as he moves between the projects. The morning unfolds with presentations, questions, and the excited chatter of discovery.
